perturbation.original_text:
Consultant shall perform the following services:
-
The Consultant will provide the Company services as a Strategic Marketing & Fundraising Consultant.
-
The Consultant shall be responsible for the strategic planning of business expansion, including Fundraising and Stock Promotion, of the
Company and its subsidiaries.
perturbation.changed_text:
Consultant will endeavor to perform the following services:
-
The Consultant will attempt to provide the Company services as a Strategic Marketing & Fundraising Consultant.
-
The Consultant will assist with the strategic planning of business expansion, potentially including Fundraising and Stock Promotion, of the Company and its subsidiaries.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall perform' with 'will endeavor to perform' and 'shall be responsible' with 'will assist with' introduces ambiguity and reduces the consultant's obligation. Adding 'potentially including' makes the scope of fundraising and stock promotion uncertain. This contradicts the general requirement of clear contractual obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Requirement for Clear and Definite Terms

perturbation.original_text:
Consultant agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Company and its affiliates and subsidiaries and their respective directors, officers and
employees from and against all taxes, losses, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including attorneys’ fees and other legal expenses, arising
directly or indirectly from or in connection with (i) any negligent, reckless or intentionally wrongful act of Consultant or Consultant’s assistants,
employees, contractors or agents, (ii) performance of the Services or any breach by the Consultant or Consultant’s assistants, employees,
contractors or agents of any of the covenants contained in this Agreement, (iii) any failure of Consultant to perform the Services in accordance
with all applicable laws, rules and regulations, (iv) any violation or claimed violation of a third party’s rights resulting in whole or in part from the
Company’s use of the Inventions or other deliverables of Consultant under this Agreement, or (v) any amounts Company is required to pay by any
court or governmental authority in any country based on a finding that Consultant’s employees or contractors engaged in the performance of the
Services are employees of Company or the failure of Consultant to file documents with respect to such employees or contractors or to pay any tax
or similar fee or assessment in any country.
perturbation.changed_text: Consultant agrees to consider indemnifying the Company and its affiliates and subsidiaries and their respective directors, officers and employees from potential losses, damages and liabilities to the extent Consultant deems reasonable, arising from potential connection with (i) gross negligence or intentionally wrongful acts of Consultant , (ii) performance of the Services, (iii) alleged failure of Consultant to perform the Services in accordance with material applicable laws. However, the determination of indemnification will be subject to good faith negotiations.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the indemnification clause significantly by making the consultant's obligation discretionary ('agrees to consider indemnifying'), limiting it to 'gross negligence', removing specific instances and introducing a 'reasonableness' standard. The phrase 'alleged failure' and 'material applicable laws' creates ambiguity regarding the scope of indemnification. The added requirement of 'good faith negotiations' can cause future disputes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Enforceability of Indemnification Clauses (California)

perturbation.original_text:
In any court action at law or equity that is brought by one of the Parties to this Agreement to enforce or interpret the
provisions of this Agreement, the prevailing Party will be entitled to reasonable attorneys’ fees, in addition to any other relief to which that Party
may be entitled.
perturbation.changed_text:
In any court action at law or equity that is brought by one of the Parties to this Agreement to enforce or interpret the
provisions of this Agreement, the prevailing Party may be considered for reasonable attorneys’ fees, should the circumstances warrant, in addition to any other relief to which that Party
may be entitled.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'will be entitled' to 'may be considered for', and adding the caveat 'should the circumstances warrant', the mandatory awarding of attorney's fees to the prevailing party is made discretionary. This creates uncertainty and could discourage parties from pursuing legitimate claims.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Code of Civil Procedure § 1021 - Interpretation of contractual attorney fee clauses
